intro: Tessenia aspera, commonly known as the rough tessenia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Tessenia aspera is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its distinctive appearance.
